titles.title: Family-Friendly Internet Access Act of 1997
To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to require Internet access providers to provide screening software to permit parents to control Internet access by their children.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Telecommunications, Trade, and Consumer Protection.

bill.summary: 3/20/1997--Introduced. Family-Friendly Internet Access Act of 1997 - Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to require an Internet access provider, at the time of entering into an agreement for the provision of Internet access services, to offer screening software designed to allow the customer to limit online access to material that is unsuitable for children.
